title: How to find out what a person was arrested for - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends where you're from/are. In the U.K, there's almost always a newspaper article, clip on YouTube on quick Google search that will tell you about a person's convictions. If that didn't work there are plenty of sites that contain some kind of database, or worse come to worse you could even try a formal subject access request, though I'm not sure whether they would obliged to follow due to the information pertaining to someone (presumably) not yourself, and that it may be relevant to an ongoing investigation or have the potential to disrupt the information.
